hed: How recent wildfires have primed Malibu and the Santa Monica Mountains for more frequent blazes
lede: A red glow illuminated the valley behind the Brunel family’s Malibu home around 11 p.m. Monday. The fierce Santa Ana winds blowing dry desert air over the mountains and out to sea had already triggered public safety power shutoffs.

hed: Why the Forest Service is encouraging people to cut Christmas trees on public lands (with permits)
lede: When it comes to finding the perfect Christmas tree, William Lyon has it down to a science. Every year, Lyon downloads official maps of U.S. Forest Service roads — Apple and Google maps never have them all — and consults satellite imagery, searching for green groves that seem decently accessible and haven’t been scorched by fire.

hed: California biofuel project aims to cut wildfire risk, but at what cost?
lede: STOCKTON, Calif. —  For Laura Ornelas and thousands of other South Stockton residents, harmful air pollution is a fact of life. Hemmed in by freeways and rail lines and bordered by heavy industry and the Port of Stockton, the area has been dubbed an “Asthma Capital” by the Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America.

hed: Cluster of farmworkers diagnosed with rare animal-borne disease in Ventura County
lede: A cluster of workers at Ventura County berry farms have been diagnosed with a rare disease often transmitted through sick animals’ urine, according to a public health advisory distributed to local doctors by county health officials Tuesday.

hed: The Mountain fire was the third most destructive wildfire in a decade. These maps show why
lede: The Mountain fire, driven by powerful winds, razed 243 buildings and damaged dozens more in Camarillo and nearby communities in western Ventura County, according to data released by state fire officials.
byline: By Sean Greene and Noah Haggerty

hed: Has nuclear power entered a new era of acceptance amid global warming?
lede: When Heather Hoff took a job at Diablo Canyon nuclear power plant, she was skeptical of nuclear energy — so much so that she resolved to report anything questionable to the anti-nuclear group Mothers for Peace.

hed: California removes slur targeting Indigenous women from location names
lede: Officials have approved the removal of the derogatory term “squaw” from more than 30 geographic features and place names on California lands, according to an announcement Friday by the state Natural Resources Agency.

hed: ‘Truly random’ or sealed fate? Why some homes survived the Mountain fire while others burned
lede: CAMARILLO, Calif. —  Stanley Jensen worked with firefighters to break open a melted safe amid the rubble of his family’s home. As Jensen used a window screen to sift the safe’s ashen contents for diamonds and stones, his wife, Dawn DaMart, wandered the blackened foundation searching for tokens of the couple’s life before the Mountain fire.

hed: In a few terrifying hours, the Mountain fire exploded into SoCal’s most destructive in years
lede: The warnings Wednesday morning were dire: Southern Ventura County was primed to be hit with the region’s most ferocious Santa Ana wind event in years, creating extremely critical fire weather in the area.
byline: By Grace Toohey, Noah Haggerty and Sandra McDonald. Graphics by Sean Greene

hed: Staggering devastation as fire levels Ventura County neighborhoods, destroying over 130 structures
lede: Residents in the foothills above Camarillo who returned to their neighborhoods days after fleeing the Mountain fire were greeted by nothing more than devastation.
byline: By Clara Harter, Noah Haggerty, Grace Toohey and Hannah Fry

hed: Emissions from private jets are skyrocketing. Monitoring them is about to get much harder
lede: Carbon dioxide emissions from private jets have increased by 46% in the last five years, according to a study published Thursday in the journal Nature Communications Earth & Environment.

hed: Mountain fire’s stunning toll: 132 structures destroyed, 88 damaged
lede: Camarillo Heights resident Maurice Kerr stood inside the shell of his burned-out home Thursday morning. With the surrounding rubble still smoldering and smoke choking the air, the 68-year-old said he did his best to fight the wind-driven Mountain fire, which started raining embers on his home soon after it started Wednesday morning.
byline: By Richard Winton, Nathan Solis, Noah Haggerty, Grace Toohey, Clara Harter and Noah Goldberg

hed: ‘Go, go go!’ Stunned residents flee as Mountain fire sweeps into Ventura County communities
lede: Linda Elmo was waiting outside Padre Serra Parish in Camarillo for Ventura County emergency personnel to bring a wheelchair for her to get into the evacuation center amid the ferocious Mountain fire.
byline: By Jireh Deng, Sandra McDonald, Noah Goldberg and Noah Haggerty

hed: Multiple homes burned as Ventura County fire explodes to 14,000 acres, trapping residents
lede: Fueled by blasts from one of the most extreme wind events in years, the Mountain fire leaped and roared through more than 14,000 acres in Ventura County on Wednesday, devouring homes and trapping some residents.
byline: By Noah Goldberg, Grace Toohey, Clara Harter, Jireh Deng , Sandra McDonald and Noah Haggerty
